info.title: Test Case 2 - Spatial Separation Between Buildings

P01.questionText: Does the Building Code apply to this structure?

P02.questionText: Check all that apply to the following structure in this project.

possibleAnswers.answerDisplayText: This project will involve the construction or design of a new building.
The project will result in a change in occupancy.
The project will result in an alteration to an existing building.
The project will result in an addition to an existing building.
The project will result in the demolition of an existing building.
The project will consist of the repair of a building that has been damaged by fire, earthquake, or other causes of damage.
The project will correct unsafe conditions in or about a building.
The project will involve changes that will affect the occupied parts of the building.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety in the remaining parts of a building after demolition.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety parts affect but not directly involved in an alteration to the building.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety parts affect but not directly involved in an addition to the building.
The project will involve the installation, replacement, or alteration of materials or equipment regulated by this Code (except as permitted by the British Columbia Fire Code).
This project will involve the work necessary to ensure safety in a relocated building during and after the relocation.
This project will affect safety during construction of a building, including protection of the public.
This project will involve the design, installation, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems.
This project will involve the alteration, rehabilitation and change of occupancy of heritage buildings.

nextNavigationLogic.errorMessage: 'None of the above' cannot be selected at the same time as other answers

P03.questionText: Check all that apply to the following apply to this project?

possibleAnswers.answerDisplayText: This project consists of sewage, water, electrical, telephone, rail or similar public infrastructure systems located in a street or a public transit right of way.
This project consists of utility towers and poles, and television, radio and other communication aerials and towers, except for loads resulting from their being located on or attached to buildings.
This project consists of mechanical or other equipment and appliances not specifically regulated in these regulations.
This project consists of flood control and hydro electric dams and structures.
This project consists of accessory buildings less than 10 m2 in building area that do not create a hazard.

This project has permission of the authorities having jurisdiction to provide construction site offices, seasonal storage buildings, special events facilities, emergency facilities, and/or similar structures.

This project consists of Factory-built housing and components complying with CSA-Z240 MH Series standard, but this exemption does not extend to on site preparations (siting, foundations, mountings), connection to services and installation of appliances.
This project is a farm building.

P04.questionText: Is this structure a heritage building?

P05.questionText: Does this project involve the alteration of an existing building?

P06.questionText: Which major occupancies will be included in this building?

nextNavigationLogic.errorMessage: 'None of the above' cannot be selected at the same time as other answers

P07.questionText: Is the building area of this building greater than 600 m2?

P08.questionText: How many storeys in building height will this building be?

P1.questionText: What are the major occupancies of this building?

P2.questionText: Would this building be required to meet Subsection 9.10.15. per Article 9.10.15 1?

P3.questionText: Does this building conform to Article 9.35.1.1?

P4.questionText: Is this building a detached garage or accessory building that meets all of the following requirements: -Faces a dwelling unit. -Serves only one dwelling unit. -Is located on the same property as that dwelling unit. -The dwelling unit is the only major occupancy on the property.

P5.questionText: The area of an exposing building face is calculated by taking the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, calculate the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min. -Sentence 9.10.14.2.(1) If a building is divided by fire separations into fire compartments, the area of the exposing building face is permitted to be calculated for each fire compartment, provided the fire separations have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min. - Sentence 9.10.14.2.(4) What is the area of the exposing building face of this fire compartment (m2)?

P6.questionText: The location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. {Diagram from Note A-3.2.3.1.(4)} What is the Limiting Distance for the exterior wall for this fire compartment (m)?

P7.questionText: Is this compartment sprinklered per Article 3.2.5.12?

P8.questionText: Does the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle arrives at the building exceed 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to this building?

P11.questionText: Is this building a storage garage with all storeys constructed as open-air storeys?

P12.questionText: Does this fire compartment face a street and is at street level?

P13.questionText: Will all the unprotected openings be glazed with one of the following? -wired glass in steel frames, as described in Article 9.10.13.5. -glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.

R0.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an answer that indicates that the BC Building Code 2024 does not apply to this structure. This tool is used to assist building code users in determining the applicable requirements for their building, as such all structures that are not governed by the BC Building Code 2024 are beyond the scope of this tool.

R1.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected {values from previous answer}. This indicates that some or all of this structure may not be governed by the BC Building Code 2024. This tool has been designed to assist BC Building Code 2024 users in determining the Building Code requirements for Part 9 buildings. Based on your selection, some or all of your project is beyond the scope of this tool at this time.

R2.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an option that indicates that this building is a heritage building. Heritage buildings have alternative measures for Building Code compliance. These alternative measures are beyond the scope of this tool at this time. Please see in Table 1.1.1.1.(5) of Division A - Section 1.1 ‘General’ for more information.

R3.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an option that indicates that this building is an alteration to an existing building. Alteration to existing buildings have alternative measures for Building Code compliance. These alternative measures are beyond the scope of this tool at this time. Please see Sentences 1.1.1.1(6) and 1.1.1.2.(1), and Table 1.1.1.1.(6) in Division A - Section 1.1 ‘General’ for more information.

R4.resultDisplayMessage: Based on the options you have selected; this project is not a Part 9 building. This tool is designed to assist BC Building Code 2024 users in evaluating Part 9 buildings for conformance with Division B Acceptable Solutions of the BC Building Code, therefore your project is beyond the scope of this tool at this time.

R5.resultDisplayMessage: Openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2m are required to be protected by closures, other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall. (See Table 9.10.13.1.)

R6.resultDisplayMessage: Based on Table 9.10.14.4.-A and Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1) the maximum percentage of unprotected openings in this exterior wall is {Max(P(9), P(10)/P(5))}%, based on an exposing building face of {P(5)}m2, the maximum area would be {Max(P(9)xP(5), P(10))}m2.

R7.resultDisplayMessage: The maximum percentage of unprotected openings in this exterior wall is {Max(P(9), P(10)/P(5))}%, based on an exposing building face of {P(5)}m2, the maximum area would be: {Max(P(9)xP(5), P(10))}.

R8.resultDisplayMessage: Based on your selections and Article 9.10.14.4, this fire compartment is permitted to have unlimited unprotected openings.

R9.resultDisplayMessage: Subsection 9.10.14 does not apply to detached carports conforming to Section 9.35. that serve not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.

R10.resultDisplayMessage: Based on your selection the percentage and area of unprotected openings should be calculated based on Subsection 9.10.15. At this time this tool does not calculate the percentage and area of unprotected openings of houses that meet the requirements of Subsection 9.10.15.
